H0.text: Longitudinal wave is the type of wave in which the medium moves back and forth in the same direction as the wave.

H1.text: Variable wave is a type of wave in which the medium moves back and forth in the same direction as the wave.

H2.text: Kinetic wave is a type of wave in which the medium moves back and forth in the same direction as the wave.

H3.text: Latitudinal wave is the type of wave in which the medium moves back and forth in the same direction as the wave.

A4.text: Longitudinal waves oscillate in the direction parallel to the wave's travel, with medium displacement in the same or opposite direction of the wave propagation.
